value.title: REPLAY Special end of year stream w/ Will Thompson (Dec 12, 2020) *Charity Stream*
value.excerpt: Join us live as we answer your questions about Power BI!   Every time the answer is "It depends", Will will donate $25 to charity! You can take part as well by donating through the live stream. Guy in a Cube is supporting the World Central Kitchen to help feed those affected by Hurricane Iota and COVID-19.
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/hLQ5St1g4S4" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Start your Power BI journey with Guy in a Cube
value.excerpt: Want to learn Power BI from the masters?   Coming from Microsoft Excel and not sure where to start? Or, maybe you've used Power BI but want to make sure you are doing the right thing. Guy in a Cube has a course for you!  Power BI Blueprint: A step-by-step guide to creating report with Power BI.  https://guyinacu.be/courses
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/XogUe3nvPto" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Using DAX to format a list of values in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Alberto Ferrari joins Patrick to walk through how you can use DAX to format a list of values within Power BI Desktop. This takes the concatenate values quick measure to the next level.  Original Quick Measure video - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SjSKCZtiNlI  Alberto's article - https://www.sqlbi.com/blog/alberto/2018/12/20/displaying-a-list-of-selected-months/
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/QYbl4k_CWBE" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Using Images from a Database in Power BI
value.excerpt: We've looked at images from sources like OneDrive and the web with your Power BI reports. What about from a database? Is that possible? Patrick takes a look at how you can do it.  SQLJason Blog:  http://sqljason.com/2018/01/embedding-images-in-power-bi-using-base64.html  Gerhard's Blog: https://blog.gbrueckl.at/2018/01/storing-images-powerbi-analysis-services-data-models/

value.title: Using the Key Influencer visual in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Patrick and Justyna look at how you gain insights using the Key Influencer visual in Power BI Desktop. This is the first Power BI AI visual, with more to come.  Follow Justyna on Twitter - https://twitter.com/JustynaLucznik  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton

value.title: Why is there a blank in my Power BI slicer???
value.excerpt: Ever wonder why you have a blank in your Power BI slicer? Patrick shows you what is going on and how to fix it! value.title: Working with images in Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows you how to work with images in Power BI. He isn't talking about adding a logo into your report. This looks at how you can integrate visuals in your visuals based on your data.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://www.facebook.com/guyinacube

value.title: Working with Time Periods in Power BI
value.excerpt: How do you work with time periods in Power BI like last month? Patrick digs in to show how you can accomplish this with a little DAX.  Fourmoo Blog: https://www.fourmoo.com/2016/09/07/create-dynamic-periods-for-fiscal-or-calendar-dates-in-power-bi/  Phil Seamark Blog: https://dax.tips/2019/10/09/row-based-time-intelligence/

value.title: How to Create Power BI TOP N Report (Variable N, Show Top 10/50/100…)
value.excerpt: Let me show you how you can create a Power BI TOP N Report , using a Variable N, that means you can show Top 10, Top 50, Top 100 or really any Top or Bottom Number you like.  👉 Download Power BI File in Video at https://web.learnpowerbi.com/download/  This is part of our complete TOP N playlist where

value.title: How to Easily Change the Data Source Type in Power BI
value.excerpt: Watch till the end to find out how you can switch your Power BI model without redoing a lot of work from using .csv or .xls files to directly using the SQL server.  First, I will show you the two wrong ways of changing the data source type and then I’m going to show you the right way of doing it.  For

value.title: How to Set Up Power BI Gateway to Connect to On-Premise Data in Enterprise Mode
value.excerpt: Power BI Gateway acts as a bridge to let PowerBI.com (Cloud) connect to your On-Premise (Local) Data Sources – like local Excel Files or a local SQL Server. Watch our  complete video series on Power BI Gateways:  https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL7GQQXV5Z8edw57_eLqD9By5mzxIqxSJ1 1. What is a Power

value.title: Power BI Apps and App Workspaces: How to distribute Power BI content to a Large Audience
value.excerpt: Power BI Apps are a terrific way to distribute your Power BI content to a large audience.  You can "Publish App" to Entire Organization or specific individuals and groups. Then any user (within the Group you provided Access to) can click "Get Apps" to consume your App - which comprises the Dashboards,

value.title: Basic Sharing, and Manage Permissions in Power BI Simple, but Useful
value.excerpt: Power BI provides multiple ways of sharing content with users. Each sharing method has pros and cons and can be used for specific scenarios. Some of the sharing methods can be used together to build a framework for sharing. In this post, I will talk about the most basic way of sharing Power BI content.

value.title: Dataflow Vs  Dataset   What are the Differences of these two Power BI Components
value.excerpt: I have presented about Power BI dataflow and datasets a lot, and always one of the questions I get is: What is the difference between dataflow and dataset. So I thought better to explain it in a post and help everyone in that understanding. In this video, you will learn what the differences between these

value.title: Computing totals by summing visible values in DAX
value.excerpt: This video shows how to compute a measure that sums the values produced row by row in the visual into the visual total, instead of recomputing the total value in the filter context of the total. Article and download: https://sql.bi/89870

value.title: Evaluation of variables in DAX
value.excerpt: Variables in DAX are constants, and this could be very confusing! Watch this video to understand how the evaluation of variables works in DAX.
